required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

id_info.org_study_id: ttt of teeth with MIH part III

clinical_study.brief_title: Restoration of Permanent Molars Affected With (MIH) Using Composite Restorations or Preformed Metal Crowns
clinical_study.official_title: Restoration of Permanent Molars Affected With Molar-incisor-hypomineralization (MIH) Among a Group of Egyptian Children Using Composite Restorations or Preformed Metal Crowns : Two-arm Randomized Controlled Trial (Part III)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare clinical outcome of using direct esthetic composite restorations in managing MIH cases and the use of preformed metal crowns.

detailed_description.textblock:
Molar incisor hypomineralization can represent a serious and challenging clinical management problem. Children with MIH require higher levels of treatment needs and demonstrate considerable management problems.
For most severely affected MIH molars, direct esthetic restorative materials or preformed metal crowns will be the treatments to choose between. A number of aspects which could support decision-making, however, are not clearly demarcated. First and foremost, it is not clear if both treatments are similarly acceptable for patients and providers.

study_design_info.masking_description: Quadruple ( Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor ) Blinding to the child participants and legal guardian of each participating child, operator, outcome assessor and statistician.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain after the restoration Binary (yes or no )

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of the treatment Binary (yes or no )
Health-related quality of life changes by the therapies
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as difference in child perceptions Questionnaire CPQ 8-10/11-14)

arm_group.description: Bulk-fill composite (Filtek bulk flow, 3M Espe ) will be used and covered using a nanohybrid copmosite (filtek XT, 3M Espe )
Preformed stainless-steal crowns cemented by glass ionomer lutting cement (ketac cem. 3M Espe )

intervention.intervention_name: Preformed stainless steal crown cemented by glass ionomer lutting cement (Ketac cem,3M Espe)
intervention.description: Covering the affected molar with preformed metal crown cemented by glass ionomer lutting cement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Children with MIH in one fully erupted molar or more.
2. Age ranging from 7-12 years.
3. cooperative children
4. Good general health.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. patients participating in other experiments.
2. Patients with parents planning to move away within the following year.
3. Patients with only mildly affected MIH molars that do not require extensive restorative treatment.
4. MIH-affected molars that have a very poor prognosis and require extraction.
5. First permanent molars that are affected with other developmental defects, such as hypoplasia, dental fluorosis or amelogenesis imperfecta.

overall_contact.last_name: Nada Mahmoud Abd el-azim Mohamed, Bachelor

facility.name: Faculty of oral and dental medicine,Cairo University
